intro: Madia sativa var. racemosa, commonly known as the California fennel or wild fennel, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its feathery leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, aromatic seeds that are dispersed by wind, and its hollow stems can reach heights of up to three feet. The plant has a long flowering period, often blooming from late spring to early autumn.
